to kill

power/force/strength/ability/strenuously

sentences.english: But nevertheless, the people expect us to work together.
sentences.chinese: 但无论如何，人民希望我们戮力同心。

definition: of one mind (idiom)
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
unity of will is an impregnable stronghold (idiom)
to be of one mind/to work as one
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to tackle a thorny problem and overcome its challenges

hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
to join forces/to give full cooperation
to work toward/to endeavor/an attempt

to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
